title: Introducing Yourself Confidently
objectives: Learn to introduce yourself in English without fear
Use simple sentence patterns for name, hometown, hobbies, etc.
Mix short Hindi if needed, while keeping politeness
Build confidence to speak about yourself in daily conversations

activities.text: नमस्ते! इस Lesson 3 में आज हम सीखेंगे ‘Introducing Yourself Confidently.’ कई बार हम simple बातें भी नहीं कह पाते, जैसे ‘मैं कौन हूँ’ या ‘क्या पसंद है.’ आज हम वही basics cover करेंगे, ताकि आप किसी से भी अपने बारे में मज़े से बात कर सकें!

activities.question: जब आपको अपना परिचय देना होता है, आपको सबसे ज़्यादा क्या डर लगता है?
options: अंग्रेज़ी के सही वाक्य याद नहीं आते
शर्म आती है बोलने में
कोई पूछ लेगा ‘और क्या?’ तो क्या कहूँ?
डर नहीं लगता, मुझे मज़ा आता है!

dynamicFeedback.0: हम basic patterns सीखेंगे—बहुत कुछ याद करने की ज़रूरत नहीं!
dynamicFeedback.1: Practice से shyness कम होगी—short lines से शुरू करें.

activities.title: Self-intro key points:
activities.text:
1) Name (आप कौन हैं?)
2) Location (कहाँ से हैं?)
3) Occupation/role (क्या काम या पढ़ाई करते हैं?)
4) Hobbies/interest (क्या पसंद है?).

इन चार पहलुओं से आप अपना अच्छा Short introduction बना सकते हैं.

vocabItems.meaning: अपना नाम बताने का simplest तरीका—‘Mera naam ... hai’ का English version.
अपनी city या देश बताने के लिए use करें. e.g., ‘I’m from Delhi.’
Occupation mention करने का short pattern. e.g., ‘I work as a teacher.’
Hobbies/interests बताने के लिए—for example, ‘I love painting’ or ‘I enjoy playing cricket.’

activities.text: कभी-कभी नर्वस होना normal है. याद रखें,अधिकतर लोग आपके बारे में सुनने को उत्सुक रहते हैं. थोड़ा-सा unique detail जैसे hobby & passion, आपके self introduction को memorable बना देता है!

activities.sentence: Hello, ______ name is Rohan. I’m from Pune.
hints: English में ‘my name is ...’ common pattern

feedback.correctText: सही! ‘My name is Rohan’—सबसे आसान intro line!
feedback.wrongText: We need ‘my’ to talk about ‘my name!’

activities.text: Phrases like 'My name is Priya,' 'I’m from Delhi,' 'I work as a teacher,' 'I love painting' से आप quickly अपना short introduction बना सकते हैं. just keep it short and clear.

activities.instruction: कौन-सा शब्द गलत choice है? Check the grammar of self-intro:
activities.originalSentence: Hello, I am from Delhi and I loves reading.
activities.explanation: ‘I loves’ is incorrect. सही form है ‘I love reading.’ या ‘I enjoy reading.’

activities.text: ध्यान दें Verb में 's' तभी लगता है जब subject 'he', 'she' या 'it' हो. अपने लिए बोलेंगे तो हमेशा 'I love', 'I enjoy', 'I work' लिखेंगे, 'loves' या 'enjoys' नहीं। अब एक और fill-in practice try करें!

activities.sentence: Namaste, ______ (I am / He is) from Jaipur. I work as a designer.
hints: Self-intro में ‘I am’ use करते हैं.
Hindi logic: ‘Main Jaipur se hoon’ → ‘I’m from Jaipur.’

feedback.wrongText: ‘He’s’ would mean somebody else, not yourself!

activities.text: कुछ लोग hobbies mention करने में भी डरते हैं. ‘I love painting’ या ‘I enjoy watching movies’ कहना easy है. Let’s do a quick poll on your favorite hobbies mention!

activities.question: Hobby बताने में आपको सबसे बड़ा confusion क्या लगता है?
options: English words for my hobby याद नहीं
Sharm आती है बोलने में
लगता है bore कर दूँगा
Mujhe hobby batana easy लगता है

dynamicFeedback.0: Hobby के words simple रख सकते हैं: ‘I love cooking’ or ‘I enjoy dancing.’
dynamicFeedback.1: Practice से self-consciousness कम होगी—बस casually बोलें!
dynamicFeedback.2: Short mention काफी है—details में मत जाएँ अगर time कम है!
dynamicFeedback.3: Awesome—phir toh आगे और refine करेंगे!

activities.text: Great! अब देखते हैं real short stories scenarios में लोग कैसे खुद को introduce करते हैं.

scenes.text: Scenario 1: A small get-together. ‘Hi, I’m Neha. I’m from Lucknow, working in IT. I love baking cupcakes on weekends!’
Scenario 2: College classroom. ‘Hello everyone, my name is Arjun. I study B.Com. I enjoy playing badminton in my free time.’

activities.text: Homemaker या Senior citizen भी Polite और आसान lines से अपना intro दे सकते हैं! next short stories scenarios में देखते हैं कैसे ?

scenes.text: Scenario 3 (Homemaker): ‘Namaste, I’m Rima. I’m from Kanpur. I manage my home, and I love gardening. My plants are like my family!’
Scenario 4 (Senior Citizen): ‘Hello, I’m Mr. Gupta from Bhopal. I’m retired now, but I enjoy evening walks and reading newspapers.’

activities.text: कभी-कभी अनपेक्षित जगहों पर भी introduction देना पड़ता है. जैसे नया जॉब, हॉबी क्लास, ज़ूम मीटिंग, या अचानक नए पड़ोसियों से मुलाक़ात होने पर. चलिए इन्हें भी देखते हैं!

activities.caption: Imagine आप पहले दिन ऑफिस में हैं, ब्रेक रूम में नए coworkers से मिलते हुए. खुद को कैसे introduce करेंगे?

activities.prompt: Speak: “Hi, I’m [Your Name], I just joined as [Your Role]. I enjoy [Your hobby]. Pleased to meet you!”

activities.caption: आप एक weekend baking class join करते हैं. सबको अपना intro दीजिए!

activities.prompt: Say: “Hello! I’m [Your Name]. I’m here to learn baking because I love experimenting with new recipes!”

activities.caption: Online language class join कर रहे हैं? Camera पर confidently introduce कीजिए!

activities.prompt: Speak: “Hi everyone, I’m [Your Name] from [Your City]. I’m learning English to improve my speaking skills. I enjoy meeting new people!”

activities.caption: Unexpected visitors या नए पड़ोसी से मिलते हुए छोटी-सी बातचीत!

activities.prompt: Try saying: “Hello, I’m [Your Name]. I live here. I love gardening and would love to share some plants with you!”

activities.text: Tip: इन scenarios में confident body language भी मदद करती है, हल्की मुस्कान, eye contact, और clear voice. Pronunciation को practice करने के लिए बार-बार बोलिए!

scenes.text: Scenario: आप international crowd में हैं, simple intro: ‘Hello, I’m Kunal from India. I’ve been learning English for 3 months. I enjoy cricket and cooking!’
Scenario: Conference setting ‘Good afternoon, my name is Shreya. I work as a marketing intern. I love creative writing in my spare time.’

cards.definition: उदाहरण: ‘I’m Priya.’ इस छोटे वाक्य से आप तुरंत identity दे देते हैं.
उदाहरण: ‘I’m from Agra.’ Location mention करने से people आपसे relate कर सकते हैं.

cards.term: I work as a… / I study in…
cards.definition: उदाहरण: ‘I work as a software engineer.’ या ‘I study in 12th grade.’
उदाहरण: ‘I love painting.’— बता दें कि आपको क्या passion है.
उदाहरण: ‘I enjoy traveling on weekends.’—helps spark conversation.
e.g., ‘I have been learning guitar for 2 months.’ थोड़ा advanced है, लेकिन self-intro में impressive लगता है.

activities.text: Flashcards se revise कीजिए. अब हम एक ‘Guided Self-Intro Builder’ करके देखते हैं, जहाँ हम step-by-step आपके intro की lines बना देंगे! (आप इसे सेव भी कर सकते हैं, ताकी future में practice करते रहें.)

activities.title: Self-Intro Builder
activities.instructions:
हर स्टेप का जवाब संक्षेप में दो। आख़िर में, हम सबको मिलाकर एक छोटा सा introduction बनाएंगे!

(You can save this introduction for future reference.)

steps.prompt: Step 2: Where are you from? (e.g., 'I’m from Mumbai.')
Step 3: What do you do—work, study, or anything else? (e.g., 'I work as a teacher' / 'I study in 10th grade.')
Step 4: One hobby or interest? (e.g., 'I love painting.')

activities.sentence: Hello, ______ (I am/You are) Kritika. I study in class 10.
hints: Self-intro में ‘I am ...’ ही use करेंगे.

feedback.correctText: Good! ‘I am Kritika’ is the simplest form.
feedback.wrongText: ‘You are Kritika’ would mean someone else is telling about you!

activities.question: Which introduction is politely direct & clear?
options: Hey guys, guess who? It's me from somewhere.
Um...I not sure, from city maybe?
Hi everyone, I’m Suraj from Mumbai. I work as a teacher.
Hello... I'm forgetful, so not sure what I do!
hints: Look for clarity: name + place + role/hobby in short lines.
activities.encouragementOnFail: Try again—clear, direct introduction कौन-सा है?

activities.title: Did You Know?
activities.body: People often remember someone who shares 1 unique detail in their intro, like a quirky hobby or interesting role. It breaks the ice!

activities.instruction: Build a key word we use to talk about 'who we are.' 4 letters!

activities.text: Great job! ‘NAME’ is often the first detail we give about ourselves. ‘My name is...’ से simple start कर सकते हैं.

activities.question: Which part of a self-intro do you find most fun?
options: Telling my name
Telling my hobbies
Talking about job/studies
All are equally fun!

dynamicFeedback.0: Name is the simplest—like ‘I’m Ravi.’ Keep it short!
dynamicFeedback.1: Hobbies add personal touch, people get curious!
dynamicFeedback.3: Well done—balanced approach keeps it interesting.

activities.sentence: Hi, my name is Alia and I ______ (love/hate) dancing. Nice to meet you!
hints: Positivity दिखाने के लिए ‘love’—hobbies में hate कम ही use होता है!
Hindi: ‘Mujhe dance pasand hai!’ → ‘I love dancing!’

feedback.correctText: Yes! Showing a liked activity makes intros more interesting!
feedback.wrongText: ‘Hate dancing’ might be honest, but less friendly for a first intro!

activities.question: Which self-intro is short, clear, and personal?
options: I am from a place, I do something maybe.
Namaste, I’m Reema from Chandigarh, I love painting on Sundays.
Hmm, guess me, I do random things.
I talk about me, but not sure how to say it...
activities.encouragementOnFail: Focus on name, place, and a personal note. Try again!

activities.prompt: Boliye: ‘Hi, my name is ____. I’m from ___. I enjoy ___. Nice to meet you!’ (Speak with a smile!)

activities.title: Lesson 3 Recap
activities.body:
1) Name, place, job/studies, hobbies are 4 pillars of a self-intro
2) Keep sentences short: ‘I’m... I love...’
3) Positive detail adds warmth
4) Hindi mix is fine, but clarity is most important

activities.text: Congratulations! अब आप अपना परिचय ज़्यादा confidence से दे पाएँगे. Next lesson में हम simple questions और answers की practice करेंगे—‘Where are you from?’ ‘What do you do?’ वगैरह. Ready?

activities.title: Next: Asking & Answering Simple Questions
activities.description: Friendly Question & Answer आपकी conversations को आगे बढ़ाती है. चलिए सीखते हैं ‘What’s your job?’ ‘How’s life?’ जैसे सवालों के polite जवाब!

activities.title: Self-Intro Pro!
activities.description:
Lesson 3 complete—अब आप बिना हिचकिचाहट के अपना परिचय दे सकते हैं! Keep going for deeper fluency!
